title: WeWork could run out of money within months. Here are four ways it can avoid that fate
text:
Farewell, then, to Adam Neumann's private jet. The $60m Gulfstream G650, on which WeWork's charismatic former chief executive is alleged to have smoked cannabis (a spokeswoman declined to comment), will now be sold off as the company scrambles for cash in the wake of its abandoned public float.

WeWork had been hoping to rasise as much as $4bn (£3.3bn) from its market debut, on top of the roughly $13bn it has already raised from private investors. Another $6bn in loans from big banks such as JP Morgan was predicated on the completion of a successful float. Now it is left with no new sources of funding - which is a problem, because this is a company that burns cash like no other.

In the first half...
description: Farewell, then, to Adam Neumann's private jet.
